verses.text_plain: Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication.
verses.verse_html:
1Give ear to my prayer, O God; and hide not thyself from my supplication. ▼
▼ chief…: or, overseer
 , ▼
▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Maschil: or, of instruction

verses.text_plain: Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;
verses.verse_html: 2Attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a noise;

verses.text_plain: Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.
verses.verse_html: 3Because of the voice of the enemy, because of the oppression of the wicked: for they cast iniquity upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

verses.text_plain: My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.
verses.verse_html: 4My heart is sore pained within me: and the terrors of death are fallen upon me.

verses.text_plain: Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
verses.verse_html:
5Fearfulness and trembling are come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me. ▼
▼ overwhelmed: Heb. covered

verses.text_plain: And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.
verses.verse_html: 6And I said, Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away, and be at rest.

verses.text_plain: Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.
verses.verse_html: 7Lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness. Selah.

verses.text_plain: I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.
verses.verse_html: 8I would hasten my escape from the windy storm and tempest.

verses.text_plain: Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
verses.verse_html: 9Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.

verses.text_plain: Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.
verses.verse_html: 10Day and night they go about it upon the walls thereof: mischief also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

verses.text_plain: Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.
verses.verse_html: 11Wickedness is in the midst thereof: deceit and guile depart not from her streets.

verses.text_plain: For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:
verses.verse_html: 12For it was not an enemy that reproached me; then I could have borne it: neither was it he that hated me that did magnify himself against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

tokens.text: me; then I could have borne
against me; then I would have hid

verses.text_plain: But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance.
verses.verse_html:
13But it was thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine acquaintance. ▼
▼ mine equal: Heb. according to my rank

footnotes.body_text: ▼ mine equal: Heb. according to my rank
footnotes.body_html: ▼ mine equal: Heb. according to my rank

verses.text_plain: We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company.
verses.verse_html:
14We took sweet counsel together, and walked unto the house of God in company. ▼
▼ We…: Heb. Who sweetened counsel

footnotes.body_html: ▼ We…: Heb. Who sweetened counsel

verses.text_plain: Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them.
verses.verse_html:
15Let death seize upon them, and let them go down quick into hell: for wickedness is in their dwellings, and among them. ▼
▼ hell: or, the grave

footnotes.body_html: ▼ hell: or, the grave

verses.text_plain: As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.
verses.verse_html: 16As for me, I will call upon God; and the Lord shall save me.

tokens.text: As for me, I will call

verses.text_plain: Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.
verses.verse_html: 17Evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cry aloud: and he shall hear my voice.

verses.text_plain: He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.
verses.verse_html: 18He hath delivered my soul in peace from the battle that was against me: for there were many with me.

tokens.text: against me: for there were many

verses.text_plain: God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God.
verses.verse_html:
19God shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old. Selah. Because they have no changes, therefore they fear not God. ▼
▼ Because…: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Because…: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Because…: or, With whom also there be no changes, yet they

verses.text_plain: He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant.
verses.verse_html:
20He hath put forth his hands against such as be at peace with him: he hath broken his covenant. ▼
▼ broken: Heb. profaned

tokens.text: against such as be at peace

verses.text_plain: The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.
verses.verse_html: 21The words of his mouth were smoother than butter, but war was in his heart: his words were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

verses.text_plain: Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
verses.verse_html:
22Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved. ▼
▼ burden: or, gift

verses.text_plain: But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee.
verses.verse_html:
23But thou, O God, shalt bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men shall not live out half their days; but I will trust in thee. ▼
▼ bloody…: Heb. men of bloods and deceit
 , ▼
▼ shall…: Heb. shall not half their days

footnotes.body_text: ▼ bloody…: Heb. men of bloods and deceit
footnotes.body_html: ▼ bloody…: Heb. men of bloods and deceit

footnotes.body_text: ▼ shall…: Heb. shall not half their days
footnotes.body_html: ▼ shall…: Heb. shall not half their days
